Management¶

Tools¶

  • import_dmis

    To import results for a protocol from the DMIS into the django-lis, run the following from the source folder of the project:

    python manage.py import_dmis --import

    Note

    To import from the django-lis to the EDC, see module lab_import_lis.

    Options are:
    • –list-locks <lock_name>
    • –unlock <lock_name>
    • –import
    • –show-history <lock_name>
    • –unvalidate_on_dmis <batch> <resultset> <receive_identifier> <receive_identifier> ...
    • –flag_for_reimport <receive_identifier> <receive_identifier> ...

Classes¶

class lab_import_dmis.management.commands.import_dmis.Command[source]¶

Bases: django.core.management.base.BaseCommand

Handles command “import_dmis”.

Note

You do not need to specify the lock name, this will be read from the settings.py

Options are:
  • –list-locks <lock_name>
  • –unlock <lock_name>
  • –import
  • –show-history <lock_name>
  • –unvalidate_on_dmis <batch> <resultset> <receive_identifier> <receive_identifier> ...
  • –flag_for_reimport <receive_identifier> <receive_identifier> ...
flag_for_reimport(receive_identifier)¶

Flags a sample for re-import into the django-lis by updating the modified date to today.

import_from_dmis(db, import_as_new=None)[source]¶

Imports results from the DMIS recording the datetime of the session for the given lock name.

list_locked(dmis_lock, lock_name)[source]¶

Lists locks.

show_history(db, dmis_lock, lock_name)[source]¶

Shows the history of locked sessions.

unlock(dmis_lock, lock_name)[source]¶

Unlocks for a given lock.

unvalidate_on_dmis(db, args)¶

Unvalidates a sample on the dmis and flags for re-import.
